Skill mapping

Practical capabilities per course, mapped to common frameworks. Use plain language when discussing with HR or hiring managers.

Cybersecurity Practitioner

cyber roles

Skills: Threat modelling, Control selection, Incident playbooks

Frameworks: NIST CSF, ISO 27001

Mapped

Learners completing this level demonstrate practical understanding of mapping threats to controls, documenting playbooks, and prioritising mitigations.

AI Advanced

ai roles

Skills: Model evaluation, Fairness checks, Deployment risk review

Frameworks: NIST AI RMF, Model cards

Mapped

Learners completing this level demonstrate practical understanding of model evaluation, bias detection, and deployment guardrails using hands-on labs.

Software Architecture Patterns

software roles

Skills: Service decomposition, API design, Resilience patterns

Frameworks: C4 modelling, Twelve-Factor

Mapped

Learners completing this level demonstrate practical understanding of designing services, producing stable APIs, and applying resilience patterns.

Data Intermediate

data roles

Skills: Data quality controls, Lineage basics, Access governance

Frameworks: DAMABOK (light), Data contracts

Mapped

Learners completing this level demonstrate practical understanding of data quality controls, lineage documentation, and access governance with working examples.

Trust signals

Acme Industries

  • Teaching: Hands-on, scenario led learning with clear outcomes and zero fluff.
  • Assessment: Transparent rubrics, no hidden curves, feedback is specific and actionable.
  • Updates: Curricula reviewed monthly against frameworks and vendor changes.

Nimbus Analytics

  • Teaching: Practical, production-ready skills with minimal theory overhead.
  • Assessment: Skills demonstrated through labs and short writeups that map to frameworks.
  • Updates: Employer feedback loop baked in; updates tracked per release.

This is not a regulated qualification. It provides evidence of skills applied in hands-on work. No endorsement is implied unless explicitly agreed in writing.

Billing readiness

Flags and hooks are in place for sponsored access, tracking sponsored hours, and future Stripe events. Billing is not enabled yet.

  • • Sponsored access tokens scoped to courses and levels.
  • • Sponsored hours tracked per link (for future invoicing).
  • • Event hook placeholders ready for Stripe enablement.
